repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: This is "copy Python dll to workdir"
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -64,16 +68,28 @@ def main(args):
             pass
 
     linker_command = ([
-        *LINKCC.split(), '-o', app_name + EXE_EXT,
-        *[filename + '.o' for filename in c_base_names],
+        *LINKCC.split(),
+        *[filename + OBJ_EXT for filename in c_base_names],
         *['-L'+libdir for libdir in [LIBDIR1, LIBDIR2] if libdir],
         '-l'+PYLIB_DYN if PYLIB_DYN else os.path.join(LIBDIR1, PYLIB),
         ]
         + LIBS.split() + SYSLIBS.split() + LINKFORSHARED.split()
+        + ([f'/LIBPATH:{os.path.join(get_config_var("installed_platbase"), "libs")}'] if IS_WINDOWS else [])
+        + ([f'/OUT:{app_name+EXE_EXT}'] if IS_WINDOWS else ['-o', app_name + EXE_EXT])
     )
     print("LD:", linker_command)
     run(linker_command)
 
+    if IS_WINDOWS:
+        # Copy extension module to workdir.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    linker_command = [part for part in linker_command if part]
    print("LD:", linker_command)
```

works locally for me.

I think if you have an empty strings in there then it actually looks for a file with no name.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,131 @@
+# mode: run
+# tag: embed
+
+CYTHONIZE -j2 embedded1.pyx embedded2.pyx
+CYTHON --embed --embed-modules embedded1,embedded2 main_module.pyx
+PYTHON build.py main_module main_module.c embedded1.c embedded2.c
+PYTHON run.py main_module
+
+################### build.py ########################
+
+import os
+import subprocess
+import sys
+import sysconfig
+from concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor
+from functools import partial
+
+def get_config_var(name, default=''):
+    return sysconfig.get_config_var(name) or default
+
+IS_WINDOWS = sys.platform == 'win32'
+
+CC = get_config_var('CC', os.environ.get('CC', 'cl' if IS_WINDOWS else 'cc'))
+INCDIR = sysconfig.get_path('include')
+LIBDIR1 = get_config_var('LIBDIR')
+LIBDIR2 = get_config_var('LIBPL')
+PYLIB = get_config_var('LIBRARY')
+PYLIB_DYN = get_config_var('LDLIBRARY')
+if PYLIB_DYN == PYLIB:
+    # no shared library
+    PYLIB_DYN = ''
+else:
+    # 'lib(XYZ).so' -> XYZ
+    PYLIB_DYN = os.path.splitext(PYLIB_DYN)[0]
+    if PYLIB_DYN.startswith('lib'):
+        PYLIB_DYN = PYLIB_DYN[3:]
+
+CFLAGS = get_config_var('CFLAGS') + ' ' + os.environ.get('CFLAGS', '')
+
+LINKCC = get_config_var('LINKCC', os.environ.get('LINKCC', 'link' if IS_WINDOWS else CC))
+OBJ_EXT = '.obj' if IS_WINDOWS else '.o'
+LINKFORSHARED = get_config_var('LINKFORSHARED')
+LIBS = get_config_var('LIBS')
+SYSLIBS = get_config_var('SYSLIBS')
+EXE_EXT = sysconfig.get_config_var('EXE')
+
+
+def main(args):
+    app_name, *c_files = args
+    c_base_names = [filename[:-2] for filename in c_files]
+    env = os.environ.copy()
+    env['CFLAGS'] = CFLAGS
+    run = partial(subprocess.run, env=env)
+
+    print("CFLAGS:", CFLAGS)
+    print(f"LIBS: {LIBS!r} {SYSLIBS!r} {LINKFORSHARED!r}")
+    print(f"PYLIBS: {PYLIB!r} {PYLIB_DYN!r}")
+
+    compile_commands = [
+        [*CC.split(), '-c', filename+'.c', '-I' + INCDIR]
+        for filename in c_base_names
+    ]
+    for command in compile_commands:
+        print("CC:", command)
+
+    with ThreadPoolExecutor() as pool:
+        for _ in pool.map(run, compile_commands):
+            pass
+
+    linker_command = ([
+        *LINKCC.split(),
+        *[filename + OBJ_EXT for filename in c_base_names],
+        *['-L'+libdir for libdir in [LIBDIR1, LIBDIR2] if libdir],
+        '-l'+PYLIB_DYN if PYLIB_DYN else os.path.join(LIBDIR1, PYLIB),
+        ]
+        + LIBS.split() + SYSLIBS.split() + LINKFORSHARED.split()
+        + ([f'/LIBPATH:{os.path.join(get_config_var("installed_platbase"), "libs")}'] if IS_WINDOWS else [])
+        + ([f'/OUT:{app_name+EXE_EXT}'] if IS_WINDOWS else ['-o', app_name + EXE_EXT])
+    )
+    print("LD:", linker_command)

comment_data.body: Ok. Do you happen to know if CPython is always built with a shared library on Windows?

comment_data.body:
I think so (or at least the official releases that everyone will have are - it might still be possible to manually compile it without).

I think the other option would be to add the directory with the shared library to `PATH` before running the exe instead of copying the dll.

comment_data.body: Hmm. I double checked how we build the list of options and couldn't find a way for it to produce an empty string. Why is this needed?

comment_data.body:
I think it's `'-l'+PYLIB_DYN if PYLIB_DYN else os.path.join(LIBDIR1, PYLIB))` - none of those are set to anything

You don't actually need to specify `-lpython314` (or similar) on Windows because they do it magically with references to the library in the source code https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/a73daf54ebd7bd6bf32e82766a605ebead2f128c/PC/pyconfig.h#L310-L316.

(That creates a whole mess of its own in freethreading, but that probably isn't a problem here)

comment_data.body: So, it can produce an empty string if `PYLIB_DYN`, `LIBDIR1` and `PYLIB` are all empty. I'll fix that instead.

comment_data.body: What is the right command to run the C compiler on Windows? I found `cl` being mentioned in MS documentation but that doesn't seem to work here.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    import distutils._msvccompiler as setuptools_msvc  # from setuptools
    ccompiler = setuptools_msvc.MSVCCompiler()
    ccompiler.initialize()
    ccompiler.compiler = [ccompiler.cc]
    ccompiler.linker_exe = [ccompiler.linker]
```

This gets me a bit further on a normal command prompt - it looks like ccompiler doesn't have an identical interface between msvc and unix.

However, it's failing the compilation steps with "Cannot open include file: 'io.h': No such file or directory" so something's not set up with the include paths

commit.message: Add embedding test that links multiple modules.
Make test easier to debug.
Allow '$CC' to include options.
Try to fix test on Windows.
Try to fix test on macOS.
Add more debug output.
Add more debug output to test.
Try to make the test work on Windows.
apply empty command part fix

verification.payload:
tree 1f4e50cc9da09cd8cea2e5e31518390ee72467a8
parent e5a7a0fd8f0d540186f140525ce80ee395a8bdbe
author da-woods <dw-git@d-woods.co.uk> 1764411472 +0000

apply empty command part fix

commit.message: Avoid empty string in linker command if we're not linking against libpython.
Use setuptools to help with the C compiler setup.
Make sure 'distutils' is available by importing setuptools first.
Adapt to different API of MSVC and Unix CC classes in setuptools.
Test runner: Remove useless quotes around CFLAGS macro options that get in the way when passing options argumentwise and not through a shell.
Let setuptools do the bulk of the work.
Do not use config var "LDLIBRARY" on macOS since it only contains a partial path, not a library name.
Explicitly use MSVC9+ C compiler setup on Windows.
Emit an explicit error when trying to embed a C main() function in a Limited API module.
Test runner: Exclude 'tag: embed'  tests in Limited API rund.
Add debug output for macOS.
Exclude test on Windows.
Remove debug code.
Use fixed dynlib name on macOS.
Fix Python DLL name override in macOS.
Exclude test in PyPy.

title: Add embedding test that links multiple modules
